intro: Dryandra nivea, commonly known as the white dryandra, is a species of flowering plant in the Proteaceae family. It is native to Western Australia and is characterized by its distinctive, urn-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has a dense, shrub-like growth habit with narrow, leathery leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
